> ```
> @microsoft-github-policy-service agree

@microsoft-github-policy-service agree

Hey @bgrgv, thank you for the contribution. We are not going to take this change because, for a small number of choices, a switch is usually better. Also, in this specific case, we want to favor readability, and we believe that the switch makes it a little easier to follow what is going on.

title: Is it possible to let the copilot start the conversation automatically?
body:
I want the copilot to start the conversation **automatically**, **do not wait for the user** to start the conversation.

I tried several prompts, like "Copilot, please start the conversation **automatically** and **greet the use** with welcome message",  "Copilot, please greet user actively, do not wait user to start the conversation".

However, the copilot **does not start the conversation automatically**, it still waits for the customer to start the conversation. 
 
**Is it possible to let the copilot start the conversation automatically?**
If yes, how to write the correct prompt.
author: zmssp

comments.body: hi @zmssp, you can probably achieve this by automatically sending a text item (could be a message like "I have just joined the conversation, please introduce yourself and tell me what you can do.")

title: Python client_sample.py not working - only no vad is working
body:
### This issue is for a: (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ X] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [ ] feature request
- [ ] documentation issue or request
- [ ] regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped in a new release)
```

### Minimal steps to reproduce
Follow all steps in the Readme and run the `client_sample.py` with any input.

### Any log messages given by the failure
It seems the input recognized is none:
```
[input_item=item_AH8qtozEODrqYcXqIaCoE] Previous Id: None
[input_item=item_AH8qtozEODrqYcXqIaCoE] Transcript: None
[input_item=item_AH8qtozEODrqYcXqIaCoE] Audio Start [ms]: 96
[input_item=item_AH8qtozEODrqYcXqIaCoE] Audio End [ms]: 800
```

### Expected/desired behavior

Yesterday the example was working fine, it seems its broken from today onwards.

### OS and Version?
macOS

### Versions
rt-client 0.4.4

### Mention any other details that might be useful
The issue is both with openai and azure. As said, 24 hours ago everything was running fine.
author: matthaeus-deutsch-parloa

comments.body: Hi @matthaeus-deutsch-parloa, we just released a new package version (and updated the samples accordingly), can you please verify if you are still having trouble?

Thanks @glecaros !

I get the following error after pulling and reinstalling 0.5.0 with both client_sample.py and client_sample_no_vad.py:

```
TypeError: RTLowLevelClient._get_azure_params() missing 1 required positional argument: 'self'
Unclosed client session
client_session: <aiohttp.client.ClientSession object at 0x10b103800>
```
hi @matthaeus-deutsch-parloa, I just fixed and generated a new release with the fix :) thanks for reporting this!
Thanks @glecaros , its working again.

title: Could we have a react JS example?
body: Could we have a react JS example?
author: john012343210

comments.body: or can someone modify the openai react example to work with azure deployments? Please
we are working on more samples, I'll try to prioritize one using react
Looking forward!
üî•üî•üî•
push

Could we have the React front end with a .net API backend? I am finding it impossible to get the audio to play correctly. I get audio back, and it's super-slow and has interference., It's the right words just SSSSSSSLLLLLLLLLLLLLLOOOOOOOOWWWWWWWWWW and loads of interference. I presume there's some magic sauce I am missing in the processing or request, and consequently the returned audio does not match the playback expectations. However it's non-trivial to figure this out! I believe I am getting binary data back from the API, which is different to the JavaScipt version which seems to get Base64 encoded data back. 

I expect many people will be running a C# API with a javascript/React front end.
Hey, #64 added a react sample. I'll close this issue for now, if anything comes up please open a new one :)
@Ben-Pattinson I'm planning on having something like that (for all three languages as the library is meant for backend consumption), can you please open a new issue to track that?

title: Missing package.json dependency
body:
Hello!

Following the readme i was trying to run `npm install` but an error occurred:

`npm warn tarball tarball data for rt-client@file:/Users/andrea.albrigoni/aoai-realtime-audio-sdk/javascript/samples/rt-client-0.4.6.tgz (sha512-GaKPJ1wLHgw23dc+ekqPAdHycRKlX1kq9/NmzwAoOpRjDfHDNcV/HfYoobwyLmNmentWXs0iPVd72aUTmNHC2Q==) seems to be corrupted. Trying again.`

this file is missing:

`  "dependencies": {
    "@azure/identity": "^4.4.1",
    "rt-client": "file:../rt-client-0.4.6.tgz"
  }`
author: skyalbrigonia

comments.body:
hello @skyalbrigonia, did you try running the `javascript/samples/download-pkg.sh` file (or otherwise download the package from the github release manually) before running `npm install`?

Thanks for reaching out :)

> Hello!
> 
> Following the readme i was trying to run `npm install` but an error occurred:
> 
> `npm warn tarball tarball data for rt-client@file:/Users/andrea.albrigoni/aoai-realtime-audio-sdk/javascript/samples/rt-client-0.4.6.tgz (sha512-GaKPJ1wLHgw23dc+ekqPAdHycRKlX1kq9/NmzwAoOpRjDfHDNcV/HfYoobwyLmNmentWXs0iPVd72aUTmNHC2Q==) seems to be corrupted. Trying again.`
> 
> this file is missing:
> 
> ` "dependencies": { "@azure/identity": "^4.4.1", "rt-client": "file:../rt-client-0.4.6.tgz" }`

Did you have an error while running `download-pkg.sh`?
Like maybe jq not installed?

Everything's fine after installing jq on my side.
@bptstmlgt, thanks for figuring that out... I'll add `jq` as a requirement for the bash scripts in the documentation.
yeah thank you! now it works!
